thread.title: BTIG Adds Brendan Daly to Foreign Exchange Trading Division

author: cnbc.com
title: BTIG Adds Brendan Daly to Foreign Exchange Trading Division
text:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- BTIG, LLC announced today that Brendan Daly has joined the firm as a Director within the Foreign Exchange Trading division. Based in New York, he will report into Alan Circle and Martin Ferraro, Managing Directors and Co-Heads of Foreign Exchange Trading at BTIG.
Mr. Daly will focus on expanding existing BTIG relationships, and will work to identify new introductions across the U.S. and beyond for high-touch and low-touch foreign exchange-focused industry participants. “Brendan will significantly enhance client coverage for our foreign exchange trading platform,” noted Anton LeRoy, Chief Operating Officer of BTIG. “His in-depth industry perspective across currencies and markets will be immensely valuable to clients.”
Prior to BTIG, Mr. Daly was a Director at Newedge for nearly a decade. Previously, he was a Proprietary Trader at Société Générale and Gelber Securities. Earlier in his career, he held similar roles at Calyon Corporate and Investment Bank, and Credit Lyonnais.
“Brendan is a welcome addition to the firm,” said Mr. Circle . “As an expert in foreign exchange trading, he will leverage his insight to help clients meet their objectives and navigate best-in-class solutions.”
BTIG’s Global Foreign Exchange (FX) desk offers clients 24-hour market coverage from seasoned industry professionals. Client transactions are executed via experienced, high-touch traders, a proprietary low-touch platform, TradeSave FX™, or a combination of the two. Specializing in emerging market currencies, options, spot, forwards and FX swap transactions, BTIG’s FX experts source liquidity from a vast network of liquidity providers.
For more information about BTIG Foreign Exchange Trading, contact a BTIG representative.
About BTIG
BTIG is a global financial services firm specializing in institutional trading, investment banking, research and related brokerage services. With an extensive global footprint and more than 560 employees, BTIG, LLC and its affiliates operate out of 17 cities throughout the U.S., and in Europe, Asia and Australia. BTIG offers execution, expertise and insights for equities, equity derivatives, ETFs and fixed income, currency and commodities (futures, commodities, foreign exchange, interest rates, credit, and convertible and preferred securities). The firm’s core capabilities include global execution, portfolio, electronic and outsource trading, transition management, investment banking, prime brokerage, capital introduction, corporate access, research and strategy, commission management and more.
